title: Palacios Remondo 2013 Plácet Viura (Rioja)
description: Cheesy oak and dull white-fruit aromas are not a big draw. A chunky plodding palate feels a bit heavy, while dry oaky flavors suggest pear and green apple. Hailing from a cold, wet vintage, this seems as though it's losing clarity.

title: Quinta do Portal 2015 Tinta Barroca (Douro)
description: This wine has structure and ripe black fruits. It is made to be drunk young, with plenty of berry fruits and soft tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: TAO 2013 Eternal Bliss Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Sour berries hit the nose on the front end of this wine that also shows somewhat reductive aromas of teriyaki, beef char and dark chocolate. Rose buds and black cherry arise on the sip, as does a slightly sour, barnyard funk.

title: Solo Contigo 2012 Colección Red (Mendoza)
description: The foxy muddled berry aromas are puzzling. This Malbec blend feels narrow and pinched. Hollow lactic foxy red-fruit flavors are crisp but not fully convincing, while abrasive, hard-edged tannins scrape across the finish.

title: Spann Vineyards 2012 Five Barrels Malbec (Sonoma County)
description: Merlot makes its way into this blend at 15%, contributing additional smoothness and approachability. Simple layers of plum and dark cherry vie for attention against a backdrop of leathery meat before a straightforward finish.

title: Umani Ronchi 2015 Montipagano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Made with organic grapes, this has aromas of black cherry and a hint of cooking spice. The simple palate offers raspberry, a sprinkling of cinnamon and dusty tannins.

title: Weisinger 2013 Gold Vineyard Malbec (Rogue Valley)
description: Citrus and cherry fruit flavors come up together, in a wine with chewy drying tannins. Aged in 30% new American oak, it finishes tart and astringent.

title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: Light aromas of toast, apple, vanilla and custard are followed by lightly creamy fruit and barrel flavors that provide interest.

title: Finca La Luz 2015 Callejon del Crimen Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Jumbled jammy berry aromas lack specificity. This has a forceful tartaric mouthfeel that supports tart plum and currant flavors. Keeping things consistent, this is angular and acidic on the finish, with sour plum and racy berry flavors.

title: Whatabout Me 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Generic berry aromas are a touch gritty. This Malbec feels grabby and rubbery, while savory, lightly stewed and herbal berry flavors end with a light brushstroke of oak along with a lasting note of gamy meat.

title: Château Saint-Florin 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot  (Bordeaux)
description: Situated at the highest point of the Entre-deux-Mers region, the estate is dominated by the ripe Merlot in this wine. It is fruity and soft with lively acidity and gentle tannins. There is a touch of wood from the aging, although the fruitiness is what this wine is about. Drink from 2017.

title: Altamira 2010 de los Andes Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Gritty aromas of grilled beef and asphalt blend with savory berry scents. Frankly, this is rough on the palate, with abrasive tannins. Savory herbal green-leaning flavors are peppery and bitter on a grabby finish.

title: Arbéta 2012 Basarin  (Barbaresco)
description: After a few swirls of the glass, you'll find subdued aromas recalling porcini mushroom, forest floor, camphor and a whiff of cellar floor. The lean palate offers raw sour cherry, espresso and a hint of coconut alongside raspy tannins that grip the mouth-drying finish.

title: Bel Vino 2013 Tatria Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Dark pomegranate, tobacco and dried black fruits show on the nose of this blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Merlot and 9% Cabernet Franc. Lots of cedar spice shows on the palate along with light blueberry and dark chocolate. It's simple but clean.

title: Castorani 2014 Cadetto  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: This opens with aromas of dark fruit and a whiff of used leather. The simple, light-bodied palate shows red cherry and a hint of spice alongside zesty acidity and easygoing tannins.

title: Château Bianca 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This offers fresh flavors of pear fruit, with a lightly fleshy mouthfeel. The length and balance are in proportion. Drink now through 2018.

title: Bodega Norton 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: This dark-looking Cabernet smells chunky, raisiny and earthy. In the mouth, it's dense and extracted but blocky and heavy. Roasted oaky blackberry flavors finish with tannic residue and an oak-based flavor of clove.

title: Ca' Momi 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Succulent black cherry, clove and oak mingle effortlessly in this simple, straightforward and light-bodied varietal wine. It also shows a wealth of rose and sage perfume on the nose.

title: Helix by Reininger 2011 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A late release from this cool vintage, this wine offers aromas of cocoa and berry. The flavors are light and restrained, framed by tart acidity.

title: Irvine Family Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: A reductive, bitter rubber component stubbornly dominates this wine. There's cranberry and rhubarb fruit, ample acids, and otherwise all is in balance. But that burnt rubber note carries right through the finish. Two bottles were tasted with similar results.

title: Jasci & Marchesani 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: This easygoing red has aromas of dark berry, wild herb and a hint of cooking spice. The simple zesty palate offers dark cherry, raspberry and a hint of cinnamon alongside dusty tannins.

title: Exem 2015  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine that is crisp while also having some weight and fatness from the Sémillon in the blend. It is full of fruit, with lemon and crisp apple flavors. The aftertaste is tight and tangy with lemon zest.

title: Four Vines 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bramble, wild cherry and touches of dill and bay leaf show on the nose of this bottling. The palate, which is thick with tannins though not too rich, shows damp and dewy flavors of marjoram and oregano, with cedar and black rock giving backbone to the tart cherry fruit.

title: Firesteed 2005 Citation Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: In some vintages (such as 2004) the extended bottle age given to the Citation Pinot works in its favor. In this latest release, it has subtracted from, rather than added to, rather ordinary fruit flavors. Leather notes in both scent and flavor come up against raisined fruit. Tannins are tough and astringent, and there is a stemmy character to the finish. Drink up.

title: Marilyn 2015 Sauvignon Blonde Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: One of the more pungent and herbaceous examples of its type, this dry wine smells like green onions and chives and tastes like lemon and lemongrass. It's best for adventurous drinkers.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: On the surface, this smells of green apple and citrus, although deeper digging reveals pickled briny scents. A pinched citric palate and dry bitter flavors of green fruits and almond skins finish mild and slightly bitter.

title: Laurelwood 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a solid, ready-to-drink effort, with forward flavors of raspberry and cherry. The well-managed tannins remain in the background, but put a definite edge around the finish, which wraps up quickly.

title: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Chatenay  (Chiroubles)
description: The high elevation of Chiroubles has produced a crisp, cool and stylish wine. It has juicy cherry fruit and bright acidity. The wine is developing quickly and will be ready to drink from early 2017.

title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2015 Três Bagos White (Douro)
description: Bright and fruity, this has a good balance of lemon and ripe pear flavors. It is a light wine, crisp but with a richer seam that gives it concentration. A great apéritif wine, it's ready to drink.

title: Nicodemi 2014 Le Murate  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of toast, oak, earth and berry lead the way. The lean palate is rather diluted, showing dried cherry and hints of black pepper and espresso. Dusty, rather fleeting tannins leave a mouth drying finish.
